intro: Cephalaria uralensis, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, covered with soft, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Cephalaria uralensis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for alpine gardens.
